title: Marine Le Pen's double life: Defendant during the week, party leader over the weekend
subhed: The leader of the French far right is waiting to find out whether her ban on running in elections will be upheld. From the Paris appeals court to the municipal election campaign, she wants to give the illusion that life goes on.
byline: By Clément Guillou (Creuzwald (eastern France), special correspondent) and Corentin Lesueur

title: Paris prosecutors raid French offices of Elon Musk's X
France's 2026 budget battle is finally over. The next one may be even more complex.
India and the US seal trade deal after months of tension
subhed: Donald Trump announced on February 2 that New Delhi had agreed to halt its purchases of Russian oil, a move not yet confirmed by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: One month after Maduro's abduction in Venezuela, the transition of power is unclear
subhed: While Delcy Rodriguez, whom Donald Trump approved to replace Nicolas Maduro at the start of January, appears to be meeting Washington's expectations, it is still impossible to know whether this situation will open up space for democracy.

title: Comic books: After Angoulême, a new French festival shows promise
subhed: After the International Comic Book Festival's 53rd edition was canceled, in Angoulême, southwestern France, the Grand Off and Interconnected Comic Book Festivals, conducted in around 15 European cities, kept the art alive.
byline: By Pauline Croquet, Adrien Le Gal and Frédéric Potet (Angoulême, southern France, special correspondent)

title: 'Trump has struck at the heart of the defense pact forged between the US and Europe in 1949: Trust'
subhed: The drama surrounding Donald Trump's willingness to annex Greenland, by force or by negotiation, has dealt a lasting blow to NATO's credibility, explains columnist Alain Frachon.

title: Mark Carney, a prime minister seeking to free Canada from US dominance
Clintons to testify in US House-led Epstein investigation
Macron keeps press at bay for meetings with public
Norway crown princess's son pleads not guilty to four counts of rape as trial opens
Spain to seek social media ban for under-16s, PM says
Dupont returns to French team to face Ireland in Six Nations opener
Malaysian court acquits French man over drug charges
Workshops to 'love each other for the long haul': When the Church comes to the aid of couples
'Everyone knows I'm the most constipated girl in France': Young people open up about digestive troubles on social media
French NGOs mobilize to remove foxes from national list of pests
Stranded in Egypt, Palestinians from Gaza dream of returning home
At the Paris Panthéon, artist Nicolas Daubanes turns to 10 sites of memory
Gaza: French judges issue arrest warrants for French-Israeli activists over complicity in genocide
subhed: Two French-Israeli women living in Israel are facing legal proceedings initiated by French investigating judges following complaints from advocacy groups. They are accused of having obstructed, through their respective organizations, the delivery of humanitarian aid to the Gaza Strip.

title: Syria and Lebanon: The search for a fresh start since Assad's fall and Hezbollah's collapse
subhed: Beirut is seeking to build a relationship on equal footing with the new authorities in Damascus, but progress has remained slow. The weight of history, particularly Syria's tutelage over Lebanon from 1990 to 2005 and Hezbollah's involvement alongside the Assad regime from 2012 to 2024, has fueled mistrust.

title: A bike journey across crisis-ridden Cuba under the watchful eye of state security
subhed: 'Cuba, an island adrift' (3/3). Le Monde reporters left Havana by bicycle to discover this country where people, under constant surveillance, have learned to survive through resourcefulness and the black market.

title: Thomas Piketty: 'European countries have achieved unprecedented levels of prosperity and social well-being'
Trump's Gaza plan stalls
'Facing Trump, Europe, Canada and Latin America have to navigate between misalignment, non-alignment and avoidance'
